name: Emerson Fittipaldi
introduction: Emerson Fittipaldi (em-AIR-son FEE-tee-PAL-dee; born December 12, 1946, in So Paulo, Brazil) is a Brazilian racing driver who won two Formula One World Drivers' Championships in 1972 and 1974, and was also very successful racing in America, becoming a two-time winner of the Indianapolis 500 and winning the CART series in 1989.
